Key Match Events: Edson Álvarez scored a 101st-minute goal to save Mexico
Mexico won an absurd penalty shootout
César Huerta scored the winning penalty after two previous misses
Pre-Game Insights: Mexico was falling, out of the CONCACAF Nations League, far away from the regional throne it once held
They were down 2-1 to Honduras in a two-leg quarterfinal inching toward an infuriating conclusion
Post-Match Reflections: Mexico qualified for the 2024 Copa América
El Tri are CONCACAF's biggest draw, wherever they go, but especially in America
They regularly sell out NFL stadiums coast-to-coast and Chicago-to-Houston
Miscellaneous Highlights: Honduras had taken to the so-called dark arts, wasting time whenever it could
The extra two minutes are easy fodder for criticism; but they were completely legitimate
Menjivar, the Honduran keeper, had been down injured from the 91:15 mark until 93:10
